intro: Ephemerantha xantholeuca, commonly known as the yellow-flowered ephemeral, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom briefly during the warmer months. The plant has a short life cycle, often completing its growth and reproduction within a few weeks. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, adapted to survive in its often arid or semi-arid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and fragile nature, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
